verses.verse: Now the word <S%H1697><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> came to Jonah <S%H3124><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Amittai, <S%H573><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"Arise, <S%H6965><s%> go <S%H3212><s%> to Nineveh, <S%H5210><s%> that great <S%H1419><s%> city, <S%H5892><s%> and preach <S%H7121><s%> against it, <S%H7451><s%> for their wickedness has come up <S%H5927><s%> before me. <S%H6440><s%>"

But Jonah <S%H3124><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> to flee <S%H1272><s%> to Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> He went down <S%H3381><s%> to Joppa, <S%H3305><s%> and found <S%H4672><s%> a ship <S%H591><s%> going <S%H935><s%> to Tarshish; <S%H8659><s%> so he paid <S%H5414><s%> its fare, <S%H7939><s%> and went down <S%H3381><s%> into it, <S%H935><s%> to go with them to Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>

But Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> sent out <S%H2904><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> on the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and there was a mighty <S%H1419><s%> storm <S%H5591><s%> on the sea, <S%H3220><s%> so that the ship <S%H591><s%> was likely <S%H2803><s%> to break up. <S%H7665><s%>

Then the mariners <S%H4419><s%> were afraid, <S%H3372><s%> and every man <S%H376><s%> cried <S%H2199><s%> to his god. <S%H430><s%> They threw <S%H2904><s%> the cargo <S%H3627><s%> that was in the ship <S%H591><s%> into the sea <S%H3220><s%> to lighten <S%H7043><s%> the ship. <S%H3124><s%> But Jonah had gone down <S%H3381><s%> into the innermost parts <S%H3411><s%> of the ship, <S%H5600><s%> and he was laying <S%H7901><s%> down, <S%H7290><s%> and was fast asleep.

So the shipmaster <S%H7227><s%> came <S%H7126><s%> to him, <S%H559><s%> and said to him, <S%H7290><s%> "What do you mean, sleeper? Arise, <S%H6965><s%> call <S%H7121><s%> on your God! <S%H430><s%> Maybe your God <S%H430><s%> will notice <S%H6245><s%> us, <S%H6><s%> so that we won't perish."

They all said <S%H559><s%> to each <S%H376><s%> other, <S%H7453><s%> "Come, <S%H3212><s%> let us cast <S%H5307><s%> lots, <S%H1486><s%> that we may know <S%H3045><s%> who is responsible <S%H7945><s%> for this evil <S%H7451><s%> that is on us. <S%H5307><s%>" So they cast lots, <S%H1486><s%> and the lot <S%H1486><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> on Jonah. <S%H3124><s%>

Then they asked <S%H559><s%> him, <S%H5046><s%> "Tell us, <S%H7451><s%> please, for whose cause this evil is on us. <S%H4399><s%> What is your occupation? Where <S%H370><s%> do you come <S%H935><s%> from? <S%H776><s%> What is your country? Of what people are you? <S%H5971><s%>"

He said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H5680><s%> "I am a Hebrew, and I fear <S%H3373><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of heaven, <S%H8064><s%> who has made <S%H6213><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> and the dry land. <S%H3004><s%>"

Then were the men <S%H582><s%> exceedingly <S%H1419><s%> afraid, <S%H3372><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H6213><s%> "What is this that you have done?" For the men <S%H582><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> that he was fleeing <S%H1272><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> because he had told them. <S%H5046><s%>

Then they said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H6213><s%> "What shall we do to you, <S%H3220><s%> that the sea may be calm <S%H8367><s%> to us? <S%H3220><s%>" For the sea grew <S%H1980><s%> more and more stormy. <S%H5590><s%>

He said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H5375><s%> "Take me up, and throw <S%H2904><s%> me into the sea. <S%H3220><s%> Then the sea <S%H3220><s%> will be calm <S%H8367><s%> for you; <S%H3045><s%> for I know that because of <S%H7945><s%> me this great <S%H1419><s%> storm is on you. <S%H5591><s%>"

Nevertheless the men <S%H582><s%> rowed hard <S%H2864><s%> to get <S%H7725><s%> them back to the land; <S%H3004><s%> but they could <S%H3201><s%> not, <S%H3220><s%> for the sea grew <S%H1980><s%> more and more stormy against them. <S%H5590><s%>

Therefore they cried <S%H7121><s%> to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "We beg you, <S%H577><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> we beg you, <S%H577><s%> don't <S%H376><s%> let us die for this man's life, <S%H5315><s%> and don't <S%H5414><s%> lay on us innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood; <S%H1818><s%> for you, <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh, have done <S%H6213><s%> as it pleased you. <S%H2654><s%>"
So they took up <S%H5375><s%> Jonah, <S%H3124><s%> and threw <S%H2904><s%> him into the sea; <S%H3220><s%> and the sea <S%H3220><s%> ceased <S%H5975><s%> its raging. <S%H2197><s%>

Then the men <S%H582><s%> feared <S%H3372><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> exceedingly; <S%H1419><s%> and they offered <S%H2076><s%> a sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and made <S%H5087><s%> vows. <S%H5088><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> prepared <S%H4487><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> fish <S%H1709><s%> to swallow up <S%H1104><s%> Jonah, <S%H3124><s%> and he <S%H3124><s%> was in the belly <S%H4578><s%> of the fish <S%H1709><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> nights. <S%H3915><s%>
